item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S11921-11922)

summary.text: Military Installation and Community Lease-Purchase Expansion Act of 2005 - Authorizes the Secretary of the military department concerned to enter into agreements for the lease-purchase of various facilities owned by the military departments with any eligible entity, including a private person, corporation, firm, partnership, company, or state or local government. (Currently, only private contractors are eligible to enter into such agreements.)

bill.title: Military Installation and Community Lease-Purchase Expansion Act of 2005

item.title: Military Installation and Community Lease-Purchase Expansion Act of 2005
A bill to strengthen civil-military relationships by permitting State and local governments to enter into lease purchase agreements with the United States Armed Forces.
Military Installation and Community Lease-Purchase Expansion Act of 2005

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
